Media

Class TurtleDisplayer

  • java.lang.Object
    • Media.TurtleDisplayer
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.util.Observer

    public class TurtleDisplayer
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.util.Observer
    TurtleDisplayer provides a quick way of getting a turtle to draw on the screen by creating a BasicForm with a Canvas and additional components that give feedback on the turtle's status.
    Version:
    1.00 (07/7/22), 2.0 (09/05/04)
    Author:
    Andrew Cheesman, David Hughes

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      TurtleDisplayer()
      Creates a form with a Canvas of size 300x300, accompanied by other components giving feedback on the turtle's status
      TurtleDisplayer(Turtle t)
      Creats a form with the specified Turtle on a Canvas of size 300x300, accompanied by other componentsgiving feedback on the turtle's status
      TurtleDisplayer(Turtle t, int width, int height)
      Creates a TurtleDisplayer with a Canvas for a Turtle with the specified width and height.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods Deprecated Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void close()
      Closes the TurtleDisplayer and frees resources when the user presses Close.
      void hide()
      Makes the TurtleDisplayer invisible, so that it can not be seen on the desktop.
      void placeTurtle(Turtle t)
      Puts a turtle onto the canvas on the form.
      void setTurtle(Turtle t)
      Deprecated. 
      use placeTurtle(Turtle t) instead
      void show()
      Makes the TurtleDisplayer visible, so that it can be seen on the desktop.
      void update(java.util.Observable o, java.lang.Object arg)
      This method is only used by Observerable classes, ie Turtle.
      void waitForUser()
      Waits for the user to finish using the TurtleDisplayer and press OK.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • TurtleDisplayer

        public TurtleDisplayer(Turtle t,
                       int width,
                       int height)
        Creates a TurtleDisplayer with a Canvas for a Turtle with the specified width and height. It includes other components on the form which give additional information on the Turtle's status.
        Parameters:
        t - the turtle associated with this TurtleDisplayer
        width - the width of the canvas on this form
        height - the height of the canvas on this form

      • TurtleDisplayer

        public TurtleDisplayer(Turtle t)
        Creats a form with the specified Turtle on a Canvas of size 300x300, accompanied by other componentsgiving feedback on the turtle's status
        Parameters:
        t - A turtle that will go onto the canvas
        See Also:
        TurtleDisplayer(Turtle t, int width, int height)

      • TurtleDisplayer

        public TurtleDisplayer()
        Creates a form with a Canvas of size 300x300, accompanied by other components giving feedback on the turtle's status
        See Also:
        TurtleDisplayer(Turtle t, int width, int height)

    • Method Detail

      • setTurtle

        public void setTurtle(Turtle t)
        Deprecated. use placeTurtle(Turtle t) instead
        Puts a turtle onto the canvas on the form. From this point on any drawing operations the turtle performs will be visible on the TurtleDisplayer's canvas.
        Parameters:
        t - the turtle to be place into the turtle canvas.

      • placeTurtle

        public void placeTurtle(Turtle t)
        Puts a turtle onto the canvas on the form. From this point on any drawing operations the turtle performs will be visible on the TurtleDisplayer's canvas.
        Parameters:
        t - the turtle to be place into the turtle canvas.

      • show

        public void show()
        Makes the TurtleDisplayer visible, so that it can be seen on the desktop.

      • hide

        public void hide()
        Makes the TurtleDisplayer invisible, so that it can not be seen on the desktop.

      • waitForUser

        public void waitForUser()
        Waits for the user to finish using the TurtleDisplayer and press OK.

      • close

        public void close()
        Closes the TurtleDisplayer and frees resources when the user presses Close. The TurtleDisplayer should not be used thereafter.

      • update

        public void update(java.util.Observable o,
                   java.lang.Object arg)
        This method is only used by Observerable classes, ie Turtle. A turtle will call this method to let TurtleDisplayer know when a turtle has performed an action, so that it may update the data on the form.
        Specified by:
        update in interface java.util.Observer
